title: The Latent Class model
text:
Sometimes, people belong different groups (.e., classes) due nonobservable characteristics. fact conditions probability selecting particular response option answering item. Latent Class Analysis statistical model estimates probability person belongs particular class conditional probabilities selecting particular response option conditioning given class. Suppose sample people respond JJ items ùê≤ oldsymbol{y} vector contains scores item jj. Also, let KK denote number latent classes xkx_k, specific class kk. , likelihood response pattern ùê≤ oldsymbol{y}, observed nn times sample, can written l=P(ùê≤)n=(‚àëk=1KP(xk)P(ùê≤|xk))n,  egin{aligned} l &= P( oldsymbol{y})^n \ &= \Bigg (\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)P( oldsymbol{y}|x_k)\Bigg)^n, \end{aligned} Assuming local independence, can rewrite conditional probabilities P(ùê≤|xk)=‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk), P( oldsymbol{y}|x_k) = \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k), yjy_j denotes score item jj. assumption, likelihood can rewritten l=(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))n,l = \Bigg(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Bigg)^n, logarithm likelihood becomes ll=nlog(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)).ll = n \log\Bigg(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Bigg). partial derivative llll respect probability belonging class kk ‚àÇll‚àÇP(xg)=n‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xg).  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(x_g)} =  rac{n}{\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)} \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_g). hand, partial derivative llll respect probability scoring particular yjy_j belonging class kk ‚àÇll‚àÇP(ym|xg)=n‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg).  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(y_m|x_g)} =  rac{n}{\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)} P(x_g)\prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g). second partial derivative llll respect probability belonging class kk ‚àÇ2ll‚àÇP(xg)‚àÇP(xh)=‚àín‚àèj=1JP(yj|xh)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2  rac{\partial^2 ll}{\partial P(x_g) \partial P(x_h)} = - rac{n \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_h) \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2} ‚àÇll‚àÇP(ym|xg)P(ym|xg)=‚àínP(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2.  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(y_m|x_g) P(y_m|x_g)} = - rac{n P(x_g)\prod_{j 
eq m} P(y_j|x_g) P(x_g) \prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2}. ‚àÇll‚àÇP(ym|xg)P(yn|xg)=n‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†m,nP(yj|xg)‚àínP(xg)‚àèj‚â†nP(yj|xg)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2.  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(y_m|x_g) P(y_n|x_g)} =  rac{n \sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k) P(x_g) \prod_{j
eq m,n} P(y_j|x_g) - n P(x_g)\prod_{j 
eq n} P(y_j|x_g) P(x_g) \prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2}. second partial derivative llll respect probability scoring particular ymy_m yny_n belonging class gg hh ‚àÇll‚àÇP(ym|xg)P(yn|xh)=‚àínP(xh)‚àèj‚â†nP(yj|xh)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2.  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(y_m|x_g) P(y_n|x_h)} = - rac{n P(x_h) \prod_{j
eq n} P(y_j|x_h) P(x_g) \prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2}. second partial derivative llll probability belonging class gg probability scoring particular ymy_m belonging class hh ‚àÇll‚àÇP(xg)‚àÇP(ym|xg)=n‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)‚àín‚àèj=1JP(yj|xg)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2.  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(x_g) \partial P(y_m|x_g)} =  rac{n \prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g) \sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k) - n \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_g) P(x_g) \prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2}. ‚àÇll‚àÇP(xh)‚àÇP(ym|xg)=‚àín‚àèj=1JP(yj|xh)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2.  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(x_h) \partial P(y_m|x_g)} = - rac{n \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_h) P(x_g) \prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2}. yjy_j bernoulli random variable, conditional probability becomes P(yj|xk)=Œ∏jyj(1‚àíŒ∏j)1‚àíyj, P(y_j|x_k) = 	heta_j^{y_j} (1-	heta_j)^{1-y_j},  Œ∏j	heta_j probability endorsing item jj (.e., yj=1y_j=1). partial derivative respect Œ∏j	heta_j ‚àÇP(yj|xk)Œ∏j=12yj‚àí1.  rac{\partial P(y_j|x_k)}{	heta_j} =  rac{1}{2y_j - 1}. ‚àÇP(ym|xg)‚àÇŒ∏mk|g=nlP(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg).  rac{\partial P(y_m|x_g)}{\partial 	heta_{m_k|g}} =  rac{n}{l} P(x_g)\prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g). softmax trick prevent undeflow

title: The Latent Class model
text: Suppose sample people respond JJ items ùê≤\boldsymbol{y} vector contains scores item jj. Also, let KK denote number latent classes xkx_k, specific class kk. , likelihood response pattern ùê≤\boldsymbol{y}, observed nn times sample, can written l=P(ùê≤)n=(‚àëk=1KP(xk)P(ùê≤|xk))n, \begin{aligned} l &= P(\boldsymbol{y})^n \\ &= \Bigg (\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)P(\boldsymbol{y}|x_k)\Bigg)^n, \end{aligned} Assuming local independence, can rewrite conditional probabilities P(ùê≤|xk)=‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk), P(\boldsymbol{y}|x_k) = \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k), yjy_j denotes score item jj. assumption, likelihood can rewritten l=(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))n,l = \Bigg(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Bigg)^n, logarithm likelihood becomes ll=nlog(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)).ll = n \log\Bigg(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Bigg).

title: The Latent Class model
text: partial derivative llll respect probability belonging class kk ‚àÇll‚àÇP(xg)=n‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xg). \frac{\partial ll}{\partial P(x_g)} = \frac{n}{\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)} \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_g). hand, partial derivative llll respect probability scoring particular yjy_j belonging class kk ‚àÇll‚àÇP(ym|xg)=n‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg). \frac{\partial ll}{\partial P(y_m|x_g)} = \frac{n}{\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)} P(x_g)\prod_{j\neq m} P(y_j|x_g).

title: The Latent Class model
text:
second partial derivative llll respect probability belonging class kk ‚àÇ2ll‚àÇP(xg)‚àÇP(xh)=‚àín‚àèj=1JP(yj|xh)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2  rac{\partial^2 ll}{\partial P(x_g) \partial P(x_h)} = - rac{n \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_h) \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2} ‚àÇll‚àÇP(ym|xg)P(ym|xg)=‚àínP(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2.  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(y_m|x_g) P(y_m|x_g)} = - rac{n P(x_g)\prod_{j 
eq m} P(y_j|x_g) P(x_g) \prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2}. ‚àÇll‚àÇP(ym|xg)P(yn|xg)=n‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†m,nP(yj|xg)‚àínP(xg)‚àèj‚â†nP(yj|xg)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2.  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(y_m|x_g) P(y_n|x_g)} =  rac{n \sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k) P(x_g) \prod_{j
eq m,n} P(y_j|x_g) - n P(x_g)\prod_{j 
eq n} P(y_j|x_g) P(x_g) \prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2}. second partial derivative llll respect probability scoring particular ymy_m yny_n belonging class gg hh ‚àÇll‚àÇP(ym|xg)P(yn|xh)=‚àínP(xh)‚àèj‚â†nP(yj|xh)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2.  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(y_m|x_g) P(y_n|x_h)} = - rac{n P(x_h) \prod_{j
eq n} P(y_j|x_h) P(x_g) \prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2}. second partial derivative llll probability belonging class gg probability scoring particular ymy_m belonging class hh ‚àÇll‚àÇP(xg)‚àÇP(ym|xg)=n‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)‚àín‚àèj=1JP(yj|xg)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2.  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(x_g) \partial P(y_m|x_g)} =  rac{n \prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g) \sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k) - n \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_g) P(x_g) \prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2}. ‚àÇll‚àÇP(xh)‚àÇP(ym|xg)=‚àín‚àèj=1JP(yj|xh)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2.  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(x_h) \partial P(y_m|x_g)} = - rac{n \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_h) P(x_g) \prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2}.

title: The Latent Class model
text: yjy_j bernoulli random variable, conditional probability becomes P(yj|xk)=Œ∏jyj(1‚àíŒ∏j)1‚àíyj, P(y_j|x_k) = \theta_j^{y_j} (1-\theta_j)^{1-y_j},  Œ∏j\theta_j probability endorsing item jj (.e., yj=1y_j=1). partial derivative respect Œ∏j\theta_j ‚àÇP(yj|xk)Œ∏j=12yj‚àí1. \frac{\partial P(y_j|x_k)}{\theta_j} = \frac{1}{2y_j - 1}. ‚àÇP(ym|xg)‚àÇŒ∏mk|g=nlP(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg). \frac{\partial P(y_m|x_g)}{\partial \theta_{m_k|g}} = \frac{n}{l} P(x_g)\prod_{j\neq m} P(y_j|x_g).

title: The Latent Class model
text: yjy_j bernoulli random variable, conditional probability becomes P(yj|xk)=Œ∏jyj(1‚àíŒ∏j)1‚àíyj, P(y_j|x_k) = \theta_j^{y_j} (1-\theta_j)^{1-y_j},  Œ∏j\theta_j probability endorsing item jj (.e., yj=1y_j=1). partial derivative respect Œ∏j\theta_j ‚àÇP(yj|xk)Œ∏j=12yj‚àí1. \frac{\partial P(y_j|x_k)}{\theta_j} = \frac{1}{2y_j - 1}.

title: The Latent Class model
text: ‚àÇP(ym|xg)‚àÇŒ∏mk|g=nlP(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg). \frac{\partial P(y_m|x_g)}{\partial \theta_{m_k|g}} = \frac{n}{l} P(x_g)\prod_{j\neq m} P(y_j|x_g).

title: The Latent Class model
text: Suppose sample people respond JJ items ùê≤\boldsymbol{y} vector contains scores item jj. Also, let KK denote number latent classes xkx_k, specific class kk. , likelihood response pattern ùê≤\boldsymbol{y}, observed nn times sample, can written l=P(ùê≤)n=(‚àëk=1KP(xk)P(ùê≤|xk))n, \begin{aligned} l &= P(\boldsymbol{y})^n \\ &= \Bigg (\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)P(\boldsymbol{y}|x_k)\Bigg)^n, \end{aligned} Assuming local independence, can rewrite conditional probabilities P(ùê≤|xk)=‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk), P(\boldsymbol{y}|x_k) = \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k), yjy_j denotes score item jj. assumption, likelihood can rewritten l=(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))n,l = \Bigg(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Bigg)^n, logarithm likelihood becomes ll=nlog(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)).ll = n \log\Bigg(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Bigg).

title: The Latent Class model
text: partial derivative llll respect probability belonging class kk ‚àÇll‚àÇP(xg)=n‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xg). \frac{\partial ll}{\partial P(x_g)} = \frac{n}{\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)} \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_g). hand, partial derivative llll respect probability scoring particular yjy_j belonging class kk ‚àÇll‚àÇP(ym|xg)=n‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg). \frac{\partial ll}{\partial P(y_m|x_g)} = \frac{n}{\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)} P(x_g)\prod_{j\neq m} P(y_j|x_g).

eq m} P(y_j|x_g) P(x_g) \prod_{j
eq m} P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2}. ‚àÇll‚àÇP(ym|xg)P(yn|xg)=n‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†m,nP(yj|xg)‚àínP(xg)‚àèj‚â†nP(yj|xg)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2.  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(y_m|x_g) P(y_n|x_g)} =  rac{n \sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k) P(x_g) \prod_{j

eq m} P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2}. second partial derivative llll respect probability scoring particular ymy_m yny_n belonging class gg hh ‚àÇll‚àÇP(ym|xg)P(yn|xh)=‚àínP(xh)‚àèj‚â†nP(yj|xh)P(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg)(‚àëk=1KP(xk)‚àèj=1JP(yj|xk))2.  rac{\partial ll}{\partial P(y_m|x_g) P(y_n|x_h)} = - rac{n P(x_h) \prod_{j

eq m} P(y_j|x_g) \sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k) - n \prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_g) P(x_g) \prod_{j

eq m} P(y_j|x_g)}{\Big(\sum_{k=1}^K P(x_k)\prod_{j=1}^J P(y_j|x_k)\Big)^2}.

title: The Latent Class model
text: yjy_j bernoulli random variable, conditional probability becomes P(yj|xk)=Œ∏jyj(1‚àíŒ∏j)1‚àíyj, P(y_j|x_k) = \theta_j^{y_j} (1-\theta_j)^{1-y_j},  Œ∏j\theta_j probability endorsing item jj (.e., yj=1y_j=1). partial derivative respect Œ∏j\theta_j ‚àÇP(yj|xk)Œ∏j=12yj‚àí1. \frac{\partial P(y_j|x_k)}{\theta_j} = \frac{1}{2y_j - 1}. ‚àÇP(ym|xg)‚àÇŒ∏mk|g=nlP(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg). \frac{\partial P(y_m|x_g)}{\partial \theta_{m_k|g}} = \frac{n}{l} P(x_g)\prod_{j\neq m} P(y_j|x_g).

title: The Latent Class model
text: yjy_j bernoulli random variable, conditional probability becomes P(yj|xk)=Œ∏jyj(1‚àíŒ∏j)1‚àíyj, P(y_j|x_k) = \theta_j^{y_j} (1-\theta_j)^{1-y_j},  Œ∏j\theta_j probability endorsing item jj (.e., yj=1y_j=1). partial derivative respect Œ∏j\theta_j ‚àÇP(yj|xk)Œ∏j=12yj‚àí1. \frac{\partial P(y_j|x_k)}{\theta_j} = \frac{1}{2y_j - 1}.

title: The Latent Class model
text: ‚àÇP(ym|xg)‚àÇŒ∏mk|g=nlP(xg)‚àèj‚â†mP(yj|xg). \frac{\partial P(y_m|x_g)}{\partial \theta_{m_k|g}} = \frac{n}{l} P(x_g)\prod_{j\neq m} P(y_j|x_g).

title: An R package for Latent Class and Factor Analysis Models
An R package for Latent Class and Factor Analysis Models
text: Install Command Line Tools: Install Homebrew: Install OpenMP support: Update Makevars Intel Macs: Apple Silicon Macs (make sure goes end file): Finally,
code: xcode-select --install /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)" brew update && brew install libomp add the following lines to ~/.R/Makevars. CPPFLAGS += -Xclang -fopenmp LDFLAGS += -lomp LDFLAGS += -L/opt/homebrew/opt/libomp/lib -lomp CPPFLAGS += -I/opt/homebrew/opt/libomp/include -Xclang -fopenmp devtools::install_github("marcosjnez/latent")

title: Latent Class Analysis. ‚Äî lca
text: Estimate latent class models gaussian multinomial item models.

title: Latent Class Analysis. ‚Äî lca
code: lca(data, item = rep("gaussian", ncol(data)), nclasses = 2L, model = NULL, control = list(opt = "lbfgs", rstarts = 30L, cores = 1L), do.fit = TRUE, constraints = TRUE)

title: Latent Class Analysis. ‚Äî lca
text: data data frame matrix. nclasses Number latent classes. item Character vector model item (.e., "gaussian" "multinomial"). Defaults "gaussian" items. model List parameter labels. See 'details' information. control List control parameters optimization algorithm. See 'details' information. .fit TRUE fit model FALSE return model setup. Defaults TRUE. constraints model checked identification? Defaults TRUE.

what: Simulate factor structures with misspecification errors. ‚Äî simfactor
title: Simulate factor structures with misspecification errors. ‚Äî simfactor
text: Simulate factor bifactor structures crossloadings, correlated factors, .

title: Simulate factor structures with misspecification errors. ‚Äî simfactor
code: simfactor(nfactors = 5, nitems = 6, loadings = "medium", crossloadings = 0, correlations = 0, estimator = "minres", fit = "rmsr", misfit = 0, error_method = "cudeck", efa = FALSE, ngenerals = 0, loadings_g = "medium", correlations_g = 0, pure = FALSE, lambda = NULL, Phi = NULL, Psi = NULL)

title: Simulate factor structures with misspecification errors. ‚Äî simfactor
text: nfactors Number factors. nitems Number items per factor. loadings Loadings' magnitude factors: "low", "medium" "high". Defaults "medium". crossloadings Magnitude cross-loadings among group factors. Defaults 0. correlations_g Correlation among general factors. Defaults 0. correlations Correlation among factors. Defaults 0. estimator estimator used generate population error: "minres" "ml". fit Fit index control population error. misfit Misfit value generate population error. error_method Method used control population error: c("yuan", "cudeck"). Defaults "cudeck". efa Reproduce error EFA CFA. Defaults FALSE (CFA). ngenerals Number general factors. loadings_g Loadings' magnitude general factors: "low", "medium" "high". Defaults "medium". pure Fix pure item general factor. Defaults FALSE. lambda Custom loading matrix. Phi NULL, factors correlated value given correlations. Phi Custom Phi matrix. lambda NULL, Phi conformable loading matrix specified arguments. Psi Custom Psi matrix.

title: Simulate factor structures with misspecification errors. ‚Äî simfactor
text: List following objects: lambda Population loading matrix. Phi Population factor correlation matrix. Psi Population covariance matrix errors. R Model correlation matrix. R_error Model correlation matrix misspecification errors. uniquenesses Population uniquenesses. delta Minimum loss function correspond misfit value.

title: Simulate factor structures with misspecification errors. ‚Äî simfactor
text: simfactor generates bi-factor generalized bifactor patterns cross-loadings, pure items correlations among general group factors. crossloading different 0, one cross-loading introduced item pertaining group factor. pure TRUE, one item loading group factor removed item loads entirely general factor. maintain item communalities constant upon modifications, item loading factors may shrunk (adding cross-loadings) increase (setting pure items). Loading magnitudes may range 0.3-0.5 ("low"), 0.4-0.6 ("medium") 0.5-0.7 ("high"). Custom ranges can supplied vectors (.e., c(0.2, 0.5))
